pullRequest.body:
$M$ is faithfully flat if and only if $M$ is flat and $- \otimes M$ preserves and reflects short exact sequences

---

if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11480933016/job/31950433446)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11480933016/job/31950433001)

This looks great. I think the comments make a big and positive difference. There are no defs here, only proofs, but the two long ones really deserved comments and now they have them. I'm sure we can do better with that `iff_iff_lTensor_exact` proof.

This is fine. I've just made a second round of pernickety comments about punctuation etc in the commented proof. I would be happy to delegate this now but won't, only because you're my PhD student so I'd rather someone else merged.
This looks great, thanks!

Nitpick, but I would much prefer the following formatting:
```suggestion
    N : Type* [AddCommGroup N] [Module R N]
    N : Type* [AddCommGroup N] [Module R N]
    N : Type* [AddCommGroup N] [Module R N]
    (f : N [R] N) (g : N [R] N)
    (ex : Function.Exact (f.rTensor M) (g.rTensor M)) :
    LinearMap.range f  LinearMap.ker g := by
```
In fact, it looks to me like you could use `variable` to simplify this statement and the ones below.
Indeed
I think this empty line is here to signify a "break" in the proof. Please use some comments to guide the reader a bit.
I have added some comments about the proof
This proof is also quite long, can you please comment it a bit?
I have added some comments about the proof
Hah! I was reviewing 15014 earlier today and had exactly the same comment. Thanks for the comments!
I think this name is funny, but also kind of bad. Probably `.iff_exact_iff_rTensor_exact` is better (it just feels less confusing than `iff_iff`). Similarly `iff_iff_lTensor_exact`.

```suggestion
This shows that when `M` is faithfully flat, `-  M` reflects exact sequences. For details, see
```

```suggestion
Implementation detail, please use `rTensor_reflects_exact` instead.
```

```suggestion

```

```suggestion

```


```suggestion

```


```suggestion
  -- By the previous lemma, we need only to show `ker l23  range l12`.
```

This is a bit weird. The previous lemma showed range <= ker, and hence H makes sense. But I would not say that H = 0 implies ker <= range; I would say that H = 0 implies ker = range. How about

-- By the previous lemma we have that `range l12  ker l23` and hence the quotient `H := ker l23  range l12`
-- makes sense. Hence our goal `ker l23 = range l12` follows from the claim that `H = 0`.

And do you need to `refine le_antisymm ?_ complex`?

Thanks.

> And do you need to refine le_antisymm ?_ complex?

No. Thanks

```suggestion
  -- Note that `H  M  (ker l23  M)  (range l12  M)`, so we only need to show that
```

Does this make sense? Do you mean submodules of something else? N2 tensor M? And again my feeling is that you should be proving equality here. It just looks weird (to me) to keep talking about having to show that B <= A instead of B = A when you have B/A in play meaning that A<=B.
I have changed the strategy in this proof, please check if it makes more sense now.

```suggestion
  -- Since `M` is flat and `ker l23 -> N2` is injective, we can compare them as submodules of `N2  M`.
```
I was following along just fine with the commented proof but now it just stopped?
more comments is added
There must be a better way to do this. This looks awful.
Maybe it can be simplified by using [forall_congr](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Init/PropLemmas.html#forall%E2%82%85_congr)
I introduced a lemma saying `exact (f \ox M) (g \ox M)` iff `exact (M \ox f) (M \ox g)`
Yes this approach is much better!

Why the semiimplict variables?
I have changed everything to implicit
Is it possible to replace this `show` by a `rw`?
yes
It seems you have more than one goal here, can you use the focusing dot?
hmm, I think I only have one goal here
I mean that there is an `exact ...` line not indented that closes a goal. What happens next?
Sorry I still don't get it. The `exact`-statement on line 240 closes the `have`-statement on line 236. I changed the tactic-mode proof to a term-mode one now.
I probably just misread the indentation in the github editor. Forget about it.
Is it possible to avoid the `rfl` here? I mean, bu providing some `rfl` lemma.
Yes, thanks for the suggestion
The variables are already in scope, aren't they? (Anyway the implicitness seems different.)
indeed, removed. Thanks!
Same.
removed
Make sure to use the same implicitness as in the other statements in the `` condition (unless you have a good reason to not do so).
I have changed everything to implicit variable
Same.
